section.p: All internal documentation shall be produced in a simple XML format. This is due to the requirement that we have to turn in both HTML-based and written documentation at the end of the project. The intention is to transform theses XML documents into both HTML and into a format suitable for printing(XSL Formatting Objects) using XSL.
While a schema might be more formal, for the time being we shall use this informal list of tags as a reference:

definitionlist.definition: This is the root tag. It takes the attribute "title" which will be used as the title of the document. A doc tag can contain one or more code tags.

This indicates a logical section in the document. It takes the attribute "header" which will be used as the section header. Section tags can and should be nested to indicate the logical structure of the document. Section tags can contain other section tags, list, definitionlist and p tags.
This serves the same use as in HTML - to define a paragraph.
Defines a target for an internal link. Takes the attribute "name"
Defines an internal hyperlink. Takes the attribute "target"
Defines an external hyperlink. Takes the attribute "url">
Defines an unordered list of items. Contains one or more item tags
Defines an item in a list
Defines an unordered list of items to be defined. Contains one or more definition items.
Takes the attribute "word", which indicates the word to define.
Defines it's contents as a source code snippet that will be rendered inline in the text
Defines it's contents as source code, that will be rendered in a separate paragraph with it's formatting preserved.
This serves the same purpose as in HTML.
